intro: Calycorectes orlandoi, commonly known as the Orlandoi's calyx, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its unique, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant has a compact, herbaceous growth habit with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers bloom in late spring and early summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, Calycorectes orlandoi is considered endangered and is of particular interest to botanists and conservationists.
